intro: Chamaesyce sulfurea, commonly known as sulfurleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves and inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Chamaesyce sulfurea is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
